newsitem.title: GERMANY: Adidas signs marketing deal with NBA, WNBA.
newsitem.headline: Adidas signs marketing deal with NBA, WNBA.

text.p: German sportswear maker Adidas AG signed a multiyear global market alliance with the National Basketball Association (NBA) on Wednesday, giving the company licensing rights to sell NBA merchandise in the United States.
Adidas, known by its three-stripe logo, said in a statement the deal gives it the right to create and develop a NBA apparel line and use league uniforms in Adidas athlete-endorsed advertising.
The deal also makes Adidas a marketing partner of the new women's basketball league in the United States, the WNBA, allowing it to use WNBA players in its advertising and promotion programs.
The contract is the latest move in Adidas' strategy to beef up its presence in the United States and take on arch-rival Nike Inc on its home turf.
In March, Adidas signed a marketing deal with the New York Yankees baseball team, giving the German company the right to make uniforms for the Yankees and to sell uniform replicas.
